item.Title: Equality and Diversity
item.Description: The college wishes to create a culture where mutual trust and respect are the foundation for working relationships between staff and students.

item.Title: Attendance
item.Description: You are expected to attend 100% of your classes. If you are unable to attend College please contact your tutor.

item.Title: Code Of Conduct
item.Description: We expect you to: Show Respect for others. Attend all classes and be punctual. Observe health and safety procedures. Comply with College policies. Copies of all policies and procedures can be found on the intranet
item.SmallInfo: What we expect from everyone at Eastleigh College.

item.Title: Safeguarding
item.Description: The college works hard to ensure all students feel, and are, safe. If you have any issues, talk to your tutor or any member of staff (all staff wear light blue lanyards and have ID badges). The college has a safeguarding facilitator. Paul Adams

item.Title: Support for learning
item.Description: If you need support to achieve your qualification, contact student support services: We may be able to provide: support with your learning. Financial cost of college. Counselling. Support with personal matters(e.g. home, relationships,progression,health, etc).

item.Title: Emergency closures
item.Description: If there are unforeseen circumstances that may impact on College opening, such as heavy snow or a swine-flu outbreak locally, information about coming into College will be posted on the College webstie: www.eastleigh.ac.uk In addition, messages will be placed on local radio stations, such as Radio Solent (96.1/103.8 FM) and Heart FM on 96.7/97.5 FM.
